definition-item.definition-title: DISPENSING, DELIVERING OR TRANSFERRING LIQUIDS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR (cleaning pipes or tubes or systems of pipes or tubes B08B9/02; emptying or filling of bottles, jars, cans, casks, barrels, or similar containers, not otherwise provided for B67C; water supply E03; pipe systems F17D; domestic hot-water supply systems F24D; measuring volume, volume flow, mass flow or liquid level, metering by volume G01F; coin-freed or like apparatus G07F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Dispensing devices whereby beverages are dispensed from a tap or nozzle.
Fuel dispensing devices, wherein the fuel is liquid at ambient temperature and atmospheric pressure.
All liquid dispensing devices which are not classified in a subclass different than B67D.

section-body.paragraph-text: Components or details (e.g. pumps, carbonators, cooling or heating arrangements etc...) of the devices are classified in B67D if those details are relevant for their structural association with the apparatus.

Components or details are NOT classified in B67D when for these aspects a (sub)group is provided in a subclass different than B67D (e.g. control taps for draught beverage dispensing are classified in B67D, domestic water taps, for which classification entries are present in the main group E03C1/00, are not classified in B67D).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing slush beverages or granitas or ice-cream
Wearable containers for sportsmen e.g. bicycle runners
Apparatus for preparing beverages which are hot (also including brewing), but not cold
Drinking devices to be installed in vehicles
Bottles or other containers with a particular pouring opening
Closures with discharging devices, wherein the dispensing device is part of a removable cap
Water supply directly from water mains (e.g. water taps), drinking fountains
Liquefied pressurised or cryogenic gas dispensers
Devices for dispensing containers (e.g. bottled or canned beverages or lubricants)

Coin-freed or like apparatus for beverages if the details are pertaining to vending operations, customer interfaces and if the selection of drinks is not strictly linked with the preparation of beverages

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cleaning pipes or tubes or systems of pipes or tubes
Opening of bottles, jars, cans, casks, barrels, or similar containers
Filling or opening of bottles, jars, cans, casks, barrels, or similar containers
Concurrent cleaning, filling and closing of bottles
Measuring volume, volume flow, mass flow or liquid level, metering by volume

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or devices for dispensing beverages on draught (B67D3/00 takes precedence; apparatus for making beverages A47J31/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Apparatus for non-gravity dispensing of beverages which are cold.
Apparatus suitable for non-gravity dispensing of both hot and cold beverages.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for gravity dispensing of beverages

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: device for adding carbon-dioxide gas to a beverage
container with the capacity of five gallons
bundle of flexible hoses for carrying a beverage

definition-item.definition-title: {by squeezing collapsible or flexible storage containers (B67D1/0462 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: When this is NOT done by some auxiliary fluid, but by e.g. rollers, pistons, etc...

definition-item.definition-title: {the apparatus comprising means for automatically controlling the amount to be dispensed}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metering techniques used to control flow
Measuring volume, volume flow, mass flow or liquid level; metering by volume

definition-item.definition-title: {the beverage being supplied from water mains}

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring volume, flow, level; metering by volume

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring volume, flow, level; metering by volume

definition-item.definition-title: {the controls involving at least two different metering technics}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The controls of the amounts involve different metering techniques for different components.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Are those wherein the carbonation takes place during a linear flow of the liquid.

definition-item.definition-title: {Ingredient cartridges}

table-column.paragraph-text: Beverage-making apparatus with dispensing means for adding a measured quantity of ingredients

section-body.paragraph-text: When in relation to constructional features of the dispensing apparatus.

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus utilising compressed air or other gas acting directly or indirectly on beverages in storage containers

section-body.paragraph-text: When the compressed gas has ONLY the purpose of driving the beverage.

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps using positively or negatively pressurised fluid medium acting directly on the liquid to be pumped

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers for dispensing liquid or semi-liquid contents by internal gaseous pressure, i.e. aerosol containers comprising propellant
Pumps using positively or negatively pressurised fluid medium acting directly on the liquid to be pumped

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers for dispensing liquid or semi-liquid contents by internal gaseous pressure, i.e. aerosol containers comprising propellant

table-column.paragraph-text: Pumps driven by steam or air

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers for dispensing liquid or semi-liquid contents by internal gaseous pressure, i.e. aerosol containers comprising propellant

section-body.paragraph-text: This subgroup contains also Selz bottles.

table-column.paragraph-text: Washing or cleaning mixers with a jet of fluid;
Accessories for mixers-washing or cleaning using a fluid

section-body.paragraph-text: Many of documents in B67D1/0829 and subgroups relate to connection means for inverted bottles.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group also contains cold plates.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. control panels, switching or controlling means.

Flow control using flow or pressure sensors, e.g. for controlling pumps.

Safety devices for flow control in beverage dispensing devices.

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or devices for controlling flow of liquids under gravity from storage containers for dispensing purposes (separating and dispensing metered quantities of liquids G01F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Apparatus for gravity dispensing of cold beverages;
apparatus suitable for gravity dispensing of both hot and cold beverages.

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of beverages involving a pumping means or a gas pressure, or from a pressurised line such as water mains

definition-item.definition-title: {provided with holders for bottles or similar containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group does also cover apparatus provided with holders for pouches, bags and similar containers.
This group does also cover apparatus provided with holders for bottles or similar containers being held upside down and provided with a closure, but with no constructional details specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {the bottle or container being held upside down and provided with a closure, e.g. a cap, adapted to cooperate with a feed tube}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closures with filling and discharging, or with discharging, devices
Packages formed by enclosing articles or materials in preformed containers

section-body.paragraph-text: This document also covers details of the cap only.

definition-item.definition-title: {with provisions for metering the liquid to be dispensed}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus requiring external operation and adapted at each repeated and identical operation to measure and separate a predetermined volume of fluid or fluent solid material from a supply or container without regard to weight and to deliver it wherein the measuring chamber is filled and emptied by tilting or inverting the supply vessel, e.g. bottle emptying apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {for the liquid container}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Other supports for positioning apparatus or articles

definition-item.definition-title: Liquid-dispensing taps or cocks adapted to seal and open tapping holes of casks, e.g. for beer {(closures with filling and discharging devices for containers B65D47/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closures with filling and discharging devices for containers

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or devices for transferring liquids from bulk storage containers or reservoirs into vehicles or into portable containers, e.g. for retail sale purposes (general disposition of plant in stations for supplying fuel to vehicles B60S5/02; for filling or emptying locomotive water tanks, e.g. water columns, B61K11/00; for refuelling aircraft during flight B64D39/00; liquid- handling ground installations specially adapted for fuelling stationary aircraft B64F1/28)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: apparatus for dispensing of fuel from containers into vehicles.
apparatus for dispensing of fuel from vehicles (e.g. tank trucks) into containers.
apparatus for dispensing detergents for cleaning buildings.
apparatus or devices for transferring liquids to or from ships.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or devices for transferring liquids when loading or unloading ships
Ice-cream, sorbet, sherbet and granita dispensers
General disposition of plant in stations for supplying fuel to vehicles
Filling or emptying locomotive water tanks, e.g. water columns
Apparatus for refuelling aircraft during flight
Ground installations specially adapted for fuelling stationary aircraft
Containers with special means for dispensing contents

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Spouts}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group also covers spouts for fuel dispensing e.g. from hand-held containers or into railway wagons and tank-wagons; loading arms.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nozzles and spouts for commercial fuel dispensers

definition-item.definition-title: for transferring liquids other than fuel or lubricants

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. for detergents for cleaning buildings; dispensing liquids into railway wagons and tank-wagons; loading arms.

definition-item.definition-title: {by manually operable pumping apparatus (hand-held apparatus with pumps for dispensing or spraying liquids or fluent materials B05B11/00)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Single-unit hand-held apparatus in which flow of contents is produced by the muscular force of the operator at the moment of use

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for locking a pump or its actuation means in a fixed position

definition-item.definition-title: {by an ejection plunger (B67D7/0238 takes precedence)}

E.g. follower plates.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring volume or indicating or recording in connection with measuring in general
Measuring volume or volume flow in general
Transactions between vehicles and fuel dispensers
Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing or fluids, semi-liquids or granular material from reservoirs wherein the volume is determined during delivery

definition-item.definition-title: responsive to input of recorded programmed information, e.g. on punched cards

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanisms actuated by means, e.g. cards, providing billing information at the time of purchase to free or to actuate vending, hiring, coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus
Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing or fluids, semi-liquids or granular material from reservoirs wherein the volume is determined during delivery

section-body.paragraph-text: Also on credit cards, smart cards or the like. Payment with credit cards.

definition-item.definition-title: {by wireless communication means, e.g. RF, transponders or the like}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of liquid meters

table-column.paragraph-text: Volumetric metering: Apparatus requiring external operation and adapted at each repeated and identical operation to measure and separate a predetermined volume of fluid or fluent solid material from a supply or container without regard to weight and to deliver it
Details of, or accessories for, apparatus of the preceding groups insofar as such details or appliances are not adapted to particular types of such apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {of fixed measuring chamber type}

section-body.paragraph-text: Technology mainly applied in the 1930's.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising at least two chambers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
One chamber emptied while other is being filled;
Technology mainly applied in the 1940's.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of indicators or registers (indicating or recording in fluid meters G01F15/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of safety or warning devices; Means for preventing unauthorised delivery of liquid

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Assuming that the correct liquid is dispensed (e.g. by means of compatible coupling or complementary shape). Avoiding tampering or cheating.

definition-item.definition-title: {relating to spillage or leakage, e.g. spill containments, leak detection (leak detectors for underground fuel dispensing systems G01M3/2892)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Of leakage-indicating devices comprising hollow spaces within walls under pressure or vacuum
Investigating fluid-tightness of structures by detecting the presence of fluid at the leakage point
For pipes, cables or tubes; for pipe joints or seals; for valves

definition-item.definition-title: {relating to emergency shut-off means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. shear valves, breakaway couplings.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shear valves also in safety valves actuated in consequence of extraneous circumstances, e.g. shock, change of position
Safety valves actuated in consequence of extraneous circumstances, e.g. excessive temperature
Safety valves with a fracturing member, e.g. fracturing diaphragm, glass, fusible joint

definition-item.definition-title: {relating to electrostatic charges}

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or devices for transferring fuels, lubricants or mixed fuels and lubricants

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or devices for transferring liquids when loading or unloading ships (ship-based equipment B63B27/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices and apparatus involving hoses, pipes or couplings, specially designed for loading and unloading ships.

table-column.paragraph-text: Loading or unloading fluids on ships

definition-item.definition-title: using articulated pipes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject-matter related to dispensing, delivering or transferring liquids not provided for in specific application groups nor in any other group of B67D.
